intro: Echites tubiflorus, commonly known as the tuberous false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a distinctive root system that forms tubers, which are used for propagation. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Echites tubiflorus thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
